Pit_Observation.activities: Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes; Instability rapidly rising;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Multiple days of inversion and +20 celcius at 90 metres ASL. FL 3000 metres the last 3 days. Crust recovery overnight but breaking down quickly daytime. Widespread loose wet and wet slab all aspects and elevations to size 3. Adjacent slopes controlled with Xh to Sz 2. Another adjacent slope Na wet slab to ground Sz 2 approx 1 metre deep.
Rassluttning höga alp. Sluttningen har fått sol hela morgonen. Ytan har just börjat mjukna.
Högt upp i SO sluttning bakom krön

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Tried to find a relatively thin location so I could reach the MLK layer and observe the water penetration of the snowpack. HS215, pit depth 180. ECTX and CTN columns both pried off easily on liquid water layers after tests. 0C temp measurements in top 40cm of profile were actually +0.2, but snowpilot won't let me input temps above 0C.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area;
Cracking; Instability rapidly rising;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Winds were strong from the E and SE, but 50ft over, they were strong W winds due to the 'local' effect. This created a somewhat complex loading pattern. Dug in a wind-loaded spot, lee to SE winds. Approaching the pit site, hand shears were releasing easily and on isolation, but not at the base of the HST as in the pit tests, instead at the base of the low density previous HST on the crust. I would judge there was 10-15cms of HST before it was redistributed by wind. Nearby ski cuts on small directly lee features released small slabs of HST and cracking.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is adjacent to avalanche: crown;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Heildardýpt var ekki mæld, en hjarn var víða og er líklegt að hjarnið hafi verið nokkuð djúpt þarna undir. Gryfjan var gerð í syðsta/neðsta hluta brotstáls flóðsins. Tvö sögunarpróf voru gerð, seinna prófið aðeins norðar í örlítið meiri halla og fór þá flekinn af stað við einangrun.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Collapsing in upper melt surface as the day got warmer. Very little reaction in stability tests, but three whumpfs while skiing away from the pit after completion. Layer is not cohesive enough to propagate at this time. Concern about pending new snow on the very warm upper layers that are currently showing a trend towards instability.
Öppet, övre TL Hårt väder och mycket snödrev. Nära noll grader.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Surface temp profile. Objective was to track free water moving through snowpack. Ice bodies were found down to 95cm. Still cold/winter snowpack below 90cm. Snowpack is starting to transition into a spring/isothermal

Pit_Observation.activities: Collapsing, localized; Cracking; Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes; Recent avalanche activity on different slopes;

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: We did not ski slope

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit dug in a Ski Area; Pit is representative of backcountry;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Some evidence that the persistent, faceted weak layer near ground has begun to sinter. Instability is still present.

Quick temp profile, and tracking free water moving through snowpack. Observations found ice bodies down to basal facets and a 60cm ice column to ground. Snowpack has not gone isothermal, but free water found to ground.
We did not take temperatures as it was clear that water had traveled to the bottom of the snowpack and it was isothermal.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is adjacent to avalanche: other; Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes; Recent avalanche activity on different slopes;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Pit site was between two wind slab avalanches that had released during the most recent storm. They were on steeper, convex, and directly lee features. By comparison, the pit site was about 10 degrees less steep. Below the bowl we had 2 hand shears fail on isolation on a layer 50-60cm deep. Believe it is the same layer that propagated in the ECT and created the adjacent avalanches.

Lítill blautur snjór ofan á þykku hjarni. Örþunn skel ofan á snjónum. Sáum nýjar spýjur bæði við Hátún og í Fannardal sem féllu eftir hádegi í dag. Veður var gott, bjart, sól og létt vestangola. Hefur verið svipað veður undanfarna daga.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is adjacent to avalanche: flank; Cracking; Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes; Recent avalanche activity on different slopes;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: First Boulder Chute. Same aspect/elevation as a quick pit I just did in Wedding Bowl which had essentially the same snowpack structure. Many mid storm avalanches noted on FCK and Ben Stuart. The main weak layer in this pit is guessed to be the one which led to numerous human triggered avalanches. Notable natural slide in Wedding Bowl took out the mid bowl skin track area and appeared to run to near valley bottom.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Сериозно притеснителен резултат (внезапно колабиране) на 57 см под повърхността върху едри фасети в ламинирана ледена кора от периода на суша преди последните снеговалежи. Трябва да се изследва на други изложения и надморски височини. Особено притеснително е как ще реагира при предстоящото затопляне.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Maa kanervikkoa. 24.3 pitin lähellä, hivenen alempana, mutta samalla vyöryjen lähtöalueella. Maa kanervikkoa. Tuulen lämmittävä vaikutus lakannut, ero lumenpinnassa huomattava edelliseen päivään. Pinta kovaa ja liukasta.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Stayed at the Gold Basin Hut 3/24-3/26. Lots of wind and between 8-12 inches of accumulated precip throughout the hut trip. Lots of wind affect but saw little slab cohesion. Saw a few new crowns on 3/26 from new snow and wind

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Overall weak and transitional snowpack in this area. Water has made it about halfway through the pack, but it remains layered with plenty of strong-over-weak layering. Wet slab remain an major concern with spring warming.
Observers: MG, NF. Test profile in 50.8, open glades.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Maa kivirakkaa. Tuuli lämmittänyt lumenpintaa epätasaisesti. Välillä kantaa, välillä ei. Ohut (10-15 cm) pintalaatta halkeilee paikoissa, joissa on kovempi pinta. Sama ongelmakerros löytyy kaikilta ilmansuunnilta. Varjoisilla rinteillä useissa paikoissa seasta löytyy vielä hautautunutta pintakuuraa.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: ALP, wind loaded feature, 10m below ridge. Goal: Evolution of MF cycle in lower ALP on N asp. and temp. gradient near IFrc.

Layer cake of crusts and weak layers. All small grains (0.2 - 0.5mm) until DH layer. Large MF layer at 61-48 cm with ice lens in the bottom 3 cm from percolation unable to penetrate layer. New snow (storm slab) was reactive while skiing.

Kommentar: ECT var svår sågad. Kunde inte såga genom skaren som ligger över PWL Torkel.
Mindre öppet fält i övrigt stenig terräng. Översta delen av trädgräns. Läsida.
Öppet i övre delen av TL. Hård vind men inget snödrev. Allt för fuktig snöyta.

Snowpack appears to be trending towards stability, though a persistent weak layer of facets remains at approximately 20 cm above ground. Note this profile was done before 7" of new snow fell 3/23-3/24.

Pit_Observation.activities: Collapsing, localized;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Hasty test pit. Found two grey silt layers down 50cm and 100cm. ECTN results within recent storm snow. After forceful taps ~40 on two separate tests "sudden collapse" propagating results down 100cm on obvious crust interface with facets on top mixed with surface hoar(?). Snowpack appears strong with very hard catastrophic failure results above MLK day crust.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is adjacent to avalanche: flank;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Lungt i början blev snabbt till hårda vindbyar med kraftigt snödrev. På vägen upp fanns inga tecken på sprickbildning men på vägen ned skapades "shooting cracks" precis överallt.
Obs: WL, LB Open sheltered TL feature.
